doc.after: Deutsche Welle (German pronunciation: [ËdÉÊtÊÉ ËvÉlÉ];"German Wave" in German) or DW is Germany's international broadcaster. The service is aimed audiences outside Germany. It broadcasts news and information on shortwave, Internet and satellite radio in 30 languages (DW (Radio)). It has a satellite television service (DW (TV)), which is available in four languages, an online news site, as well as its own center for international media development, DW Akademie. Deutsche Welle is similar to international broadcasters such as the BBC World Service, France 24, Voice of America, Radio Canada International, Radio Free Europe and Radio France Internationale.
